title: Drinks

properties.name: description
properties.value: Drinks are food items that are related to some sort of liquid that can come from a cup, tankard, beer glass, cocktail glass, or other container. Often the consumption of drinks will result in more than just healing hitpoints, but will change your skill stats as well, either giving a bonus or a penalty. Although some drinks can heal hitpoints, food is easier to obtain and heals more hitpoints than drinks.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:DrinksThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Drinks

Drinks are food items that are related to some sort of liquid that can come from a cup, tankard, beer glass, cocktail glass, or other container. Often the consumption of drinks will result in more than just healing hitpoints, but will change your skill stats as well, either giving a bonus or a penalty. Although some drinks can heal hitpoints, food is easier to obtain and heals more hitpoints than drinks.

Contents

  • 1 Ale
    • 1.1 How to brew ales
  • 2 Cocktails
  • 3 Bottled Drinks
  • 4 Tea
    • 4.1 How to make nettle tea
    • 4.2 Construction level boosting tea
  • 5 Dairy
    • 5.1 How to make chocolatey milk
  • 6 Wine
  • 7 See also

Ale[edit | edit source]

Name Heals Where it can be bought Notes Members
Asgarnian ale* 2 Rising Sun Inn in Falador Increases Strength level by 2, decreases Attack by 4. 0
Axeman's folly* 1 Player-made Increases Woodcutting by 1, lowers Attack and Strength by 3. 1
Bandit's brew 1 Bandit Camp (Kharidian Desert) Increases Thieving by 1. 1
Beer 1 Almost any bar. Increases Strength by 2, but lowers Attack by 4. 0
Beer tankard Longhall in Rellekka after completing The Fremennik Trials Increases Strength by 2, but lowers Attack by 4. 1
Keg of beer 15 Longhall in Rellekka after completing The Fremennik Trials Lowers Attack by 40 and increases Strength by 10. 1
Chef's delight* 1 Player-made Increases Cooking by 1-5 (depending on natural Cooking level), lowers Attack and Strength by 2. 1
Cider* 2 Miscellania, Hosidius, Prifddinas Increases Farming by 1, decreases Attack and Strength by 2. 1
Dragon bitter* 1 Dragon Inn in Yanille Increases Strength by 2, decreases Attack by 1. 1
Dwarven stout* 1 Rising Sun Inn in Falador. Increases Smithing and Mining by 1, decreases Attack by 4, decreases Strength and Defence by 3. 0
Greenman's ale* 1 Dragon Inn in Yanille Increases Herblore by 1, decreases Attack by 4. 1
Grog 3 The Shrimp and Parrot in Brimhaven, The Asp & Snake Bar in Pollnivneach Increases Strength by 3 and lowers Attack by 6. 1
Moonlight mead* 4 Roavar in Canifis No effect, but your characters says it tastes like something died in their mouth. 1
Slayer's respite* 1 Player-made Increases Slayer by 1, lowers Attack and Strength by 2. 1
Wizard's mind bomb* 1 Rising Sun Inn in Falador Increases Magic level by 2 or 3, decreases Attack by 4, decreases Strength and Defence by 3. 0

* Mature versions of these ales also exist.

How to brew ales[edit | edit source]

Main article: Brewing
  1. Add two buckets of water to a fermenting vat.
  2. Add two lots of barley malt to the fermenting vat.
  3. Add the main ingredient of whatever drink you're making to the fermenting vat.
  4. Add a pot of ale yeast.
  5. Wait for several days, depending on what type of drink you are brewing.
  6. Turn the valve to let the liquid run into the barrel.
  7. Use a calquat keg or a beer glass on the barrel to empty the contents.

Cocktails[edit | edit source]

There are seven different types of cocktails players can make. They are mixed in a Cocktail shaker and served in a Cocktail glass.

Type Level Basic Ingredients Secondary Ingredients
Fruit blast 6 1 pineapple, 1 lemon, 1 orange
 1 lemon slices
Pineapple punch 8 2 pineapple, 1 lemon, 1 orange
 1 lime chunks, 1 pineapple chunks, 1 orange slices
Wizard blizzard 18 2 vodka, 1 gin, 1 lime, 1 lemon, 1 orange
 1 pineapple chunks, 1 sliced lime
Short green guy 20 1 vodka, 3 limes
 1 sliced lime, 1 equa leaves
Drunk dragon 32 1 vodka, 1 gin, 1 dwellberries
 Heat, 1 pineapple chunks, 1 pot of cream
Choc saturday 33 1 whisky, 1 chocolate bar, 1 equa leaves, 1 bucket of milk
 Heat, 1 chocolate dust, 1 pot of cream
Blurberry special 37 1 vodka, 1 brandy, 1 gin, 2 lemons, 1 orange
 1 lemon chunks, 1 orange chunks, 1 equa leaves, 1 sliced lime

Whisky 5 Funch's Fine Groceries

Bottle of wine 14 Wine Shop. 500 Decreases Players Attack by 3, Increases Strength by 1

Tea[edit | edit source]

Drink Store Location Store Price
Cup of tea Varrock 10
Guthix rest N/A N/A
Nettle tea N/A N/A

How to make nettle tea[edit | edit source]

  1. Fill a bowl with water.
  2. Add nettles to the bowl of water.
  3. Use the nettle-water with a Cooking range or a fire to get a bowl of nettle tea.
  4. If you want to drink your tea from a cup, use the bowl of nettle tea with a cup.

Construction level boosting tea[edit | edit source]

Making a cup of tea requires level 20 cooking and gives the player 52 experience. The following constructs must be present in the kitchen: a stove, a larder, a shelf, and a sink.

  1. Remove a kettle, a teapot and one or more Porcelain cups from the shelf.
  2. Remove one unit of tea leaves from the larder.
  3. Use the kettle on the sink to fill it with water.
  4. Use the full kettle of water on the range to bring it to a boil.
  5. Use the tea leaves on the teapot to fill the teapot.
  6. Remove the kettle from the range when the message "The kettle boils." is received.
  7. Use the hot kettle on the teapot with leaves to create four servings of tea. This is the only step that grants cooking experience.
  8. Use the pot of tea on a cup to pour a cup of tea.

Servants (the maid, cook, butler, and demon butler) will make tea for the player provided the kitchen has the required constructs.

Dairy[edit | edit source]

Drink Store Location Store Price
Chocolatey milk N/A N/A

How to make chocolatey milk[edit | edit source]

  1. Use a bucket with a cow to get milk.
  2. Take a chocolate bar and use it with a pestle and mortar to get chocolate dust.
  3. Use the chocolate dust with the bucket of milk to get chocolatey milk.

Wine[edit | edit source]

Main article: Wine

An alcoholic drink made from fermenting grapes in a jug of water, requiring 35 Cooking. It heals 11 Hitpoints and drains Attack by 2.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Potions
